description: Maximal product of any two numbers whose concatenation is n.
links: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..9999
maple: a:= proc(n) local l, m; l:= convert(n, base, 10); m:= nops(l);      `if`(m<2, 0, max(seq(parse(cat(seq(l[m-i], i=0..j-1)))       *parse(cat(seq(l[m-i], i=j..m-1))), j=1..m)))    end:seq(a(n), n=0..120);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, May 22 2009
prog: (Haskell)a035930 n | n < 10    = 0          | otherwise = maximum $ zipWith (*)            (map read $ init $ tail $ inits $ show n)            (map read $ tail $ init $ tails $ show n)-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Aug 14 2011
author: _Erich Friedman_
extensions: An erroneous formula was deleted by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 23 2008
